title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.4: COMMUNITY NUTRI PRACTICES

description.narrative: By 2020, adolescent girls, mothers, caregivers and communities have knowledge on essential nutrition practices including in humanitarian situations, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Early Childhood Development, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women, and children under five utilize quality nutrition services offering high impact interventions and promoting optimal nutrition behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, adolescent girls, mothers, caregivers and communities have knowledge on essential nutrition practices including inhumanitarian situations

description.narrative: The Country Office helped to improve the demand in nutrition through the design, planning, and implementation of partnerships with local and international NGOs, mass and social media communication with a focus on breastfeeding and infant and young child feeding promotion, and food-system strategies for improving nutrition and complementary feeding of children under two. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2021
